meta.title: Digg - What the Internet is talking about right now

div.div: AFRICA

div.a: Why Do So Many African Leaders Die In Office?

div.div: It's rare for the leader of a country to die in office. Since 2008, it's happened 13 times worldwide â€” but 10 of those leaders have been African. Why is it so much more common in this one continent?

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/SFtxgo&via=Digg&text=Why Do So Many African Leaders Die In Office?

div.div: HIDE YO' KIDS, HIDE YO' PHONES

div.a: These Are The Samsung Products Apple Wants Banned

div.div: Is your smartphone in danger of being taken off the market? You can find out now as Apple has listed the Samsung devices it wants banned from the U.S. market following its sweeping legal victory over the South Korean electronics manufacturer.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/PnrqZy&via=Digg&text=These Are The Samsung Products Apple Wants Banned

div.div: NEED MORE PEP IN OUR POP

div.a: The Sad State Of Pop Music

div.div: Researchers have confirmed what many suspected â€” pop music over the last five decades has grown progressively more sad-sounding and emotionally ambiguous.
CLOSE CALLS

div.a: Watch Neil Armstrong Narrowly Escape A Fiery Death

div.div: In 1968, Neil Armstrong was piloting a lunar landing research vehicle during a test run when something went horribly wrong and he was forced to bail out.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/NRMJXe&via=Digg&text=Watch Neil Armstrong Narrowly Escape A Fiery Death

div.div: TIME

div.a: The Mystery Of The Stopped Clock Illusion

div.div: Ever stared at a second hand and think that time seems to stands still for a moment? Itâ€™s not just you.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/OEHS8P&via=Digg&text=The Mystery Of The Stopped Clock Illusion

div.div: GUNS

div.a: U.S. Dominates Global Arms Sale Market

div.div: Overseas weapons sales by the United States totaled $66.3 billion last year, or more than three-quarters of the global arms market, valued at $85.3 billion in 2011. Russia was a distant second, with $4.8 billion in deals.
GROWN MEN NAMED SCOOTER

div.a: The Mogul Who Made Justin Bieber

div.div: Scooter Braun, a former Atlanta party promoter, has become the central figure in the current teen-pop explosion.
NOW WHO WILL REMEMBER HIM?

div.a: Say Goodbye To Prince Harry's Secret Facebook Account

div.div: A Facebook page reportedly maintained by Prince Harry under the pseudonym Spike Wells has been shuttered in the wake of last week's strip billiards scandal.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/RSLWaj&via=Digg&text=Say Goodbye To Prince Harry's Secret Facebook Account

div.div: SMARTER THAN THE AVERAGE APE
Certain apes appear to be much smarter than others, with at least one chimpanzee now characterized as being "exceptional" when compared to other chimps.
THE ENEMY WITHIN

div.a: Prosecutors: U.S. Soldiers Plotted To Kill President Obama

div.div: Prosecutors say a murder case against four soldiers in Georgia has revealed they formed an anarchist militia within the U.S. military with plans to overthrow the federal government.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/NWES6t&via=Digg&text=Prosecutors: U.S. Soldiers Plotted To Kill President Obama

div.div: TAKING IT TO THE TWEETS
Twitter has removed the ability for users to determine exactly what client was used to post a message to its service from the web client.
RACE RELATIONS

div.a: Gabby Douglas: I Was Called 'Slave' During Gymnastics Training In Virginia

div.div: Gabby Douglas, who took home gymnastics gold for her individual performance and for her work as part of the American team, tells Oprah that things got so bad, she threatened to quit.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/Qo3Pfz&via=Digg&text=Gabby Douglas: I Was Called 'Slave' During Gymnastics Training In Virginia

div.div: ALTERNATIVE ENERGY

div.a: How Much Less Coal Must Be Burned To Slow Climate Change?

div.div: Coal-burning remains the single largest source of all the greenhouse gases dumped into Earth's atmosphere.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/SHV5Aa&via=Digg&text=How Much Less Coal Must Be Burned To Slow Climate Change?

div.div: MACGYVER WOULD BE PROUD

div.a: How To Dry A Tennis Court

div.div: Rain has historically been a problem at the US Open. Back in 1969 tournament organizers came up with a novel solution to dry the grass ahead of the men's final.

li.div: Video of a helicopter being used to dry the US Open courts in '69. Where's that good ole American ingenuity now, guys? usatoday.com/sports/tennis...

div.div: KEYNOTE STRIPPER

div.a: Palin-Impersonating Stripper Draws Big Crowds In Tampa

div.div: Porn starlet Lisa Ann â€” who impersonates former Alaska Gov. Sarah Palin in several XXX movies â€” descended on Tampa this weekend to unveil her curvaceous platform at Thee DollHouse strip club.
